intro: Senecio albolanatus, commonly known as the Whiteleaf Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a woolly texture, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Senecio albolanatus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
